bibl.title: Despatch from William D. McCoy to William F. Wharton, December 31, 1892
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p: No. 18. Consulate-General, U. S. A., Monrovia, Liberia, December 31, 1892
Mr. William D. McCoy, to the Department of State.
No. 18. Consulate-General, U. S. A., Monrovia, Liberia, December 31, 1892.
Honorable William F. Wharton, Assistant Secretary of State, WASHINGTON, D. C.
Sir: I have the honor of presenting the inclosed Reports for the Quarter ending this date.
I am, sir-- Your obedient servant,
William D. McCoy, U.S. Minister-Resident and Consul-General

Inclosures-- 1. Summary of Business for the Quarter.. 2. Digest of the Invoice Book. 3. Arrivals & Departure of Vessels. 4. Record of Notarial Services. 5. Record of Treasury Fees received. 6. Record of Bills of Health issued. 7. Salary Account
8. Contingent Expense Account. 9. Register of Official Letters for the Quarter 10. ,, ,, ,, ,, ,, ,, Year. 11. Abstract of Contingent Expenses. 12. Vouchers for Expenditures.
